page.title: 02HOUGHTON PARK_LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Houghton Park covers about 3 square kilometres.I live at a cottage in the park.There is an ancient wood in the park called Kings Wood because{Henry {VIII}used to walk there .Houghton House is a famous land mark in the park.It was built in{1743,}but the Duke of Bedford pulled the roof off because he thought Woburn Abbey was the prettiest house in all the land.The farm cottages in Houghton Park were built in{1950.}There is one farm with 110 acres,2 small holdings with 20 acres each.Living on top of Ampthill hill is great,you can see for miles. Houghton Park is right on top of Ampthill hill. Kingswood Cottage, where I live,was built in{1843}and is on the very top of the hill.
